text:
Liquor Licensing (Infringement Notices) Regulations 2018

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council and on the recommendation of the Executive Council, make the following regulations under the Liquor Licensing Act 1990 .

18 June 2018

C. WARNER

Governor

By Her Excellency's Command,

PETER GUTWEIN

Treasurer

1. Short title
    These regulations may be cited as the Liquor Licensing (Infringement Notices) Regulations 2018 .

2. Commencement
    These regulations take effect on 25 June 2018.

3. Interpretation
    In these regulations –
        Act means the Liquor Licensing Act 1990 .

4. Offences under Act
    For the purposes of section 223 of the Act –
            (a) an offence under a section of the Act specified in column 2 of the table in Schedule 1 is a prescribed offence; and
            (b) the penalty specified in column 3 of that table in respect of that offence is the prescribed penalty for that offence.

5. Offences under Liquor Licensing Regulations 2016
    For the purposes of section 223 of the Act –
            (a) an offence under a provision of the Liquor Licensing Regulations 2016 specified in column 2 of the table in Schedule 2 is a prescribed offence; and
            (b) the penalty specified in column 3 of that table in respect of that offence is the prescribed penalty for that offence.

SCHEDULE 1 - Offences under Liquor Licensing Act 1990
